result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Kau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concur to 15CF149 in Iowa Co. If successful on probation on this case, case 15CF1669 will be dismissed.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $253  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Random UA & BA testing at discretion of agent.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: 20 hrs/wk if not in treatment, work or school.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L Kau
